definition: of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)

sentences.english: On the east, your southern boundary will start from the end of the Salt Sea
sentences.chinese: 南角要從尋的曠野，貼着以東的邊界。

sentences.english: Bai Zhou is summer dream for future husband.
sentences.chinese: 白宙是夏夢尋的未婚夫。

sentences.english: A step-by-step to their own hearts sign of that either.
sentences.chinese: 給自己一片步跡可尋的心靈。

sentences.english: We regret the four of the items enquired for in your Fax are unfortunately not available for export.
sentences.chinese: 很遺憾，貴方傳真所尋的四項商品均無貨可供。

sentences.english: They left Ezion Geber and camped at Kadesh, in the Desert of Zin.
sentences.chinese: 從以旬迦別起行，安營在尋的曠野，就是加低斯。

sentences.english: So they went up, and searched the land from the wilderness of Zin unto Rehob, as men come to Hamath.
sentences.chinese: 他們上去窺探那地，從尋的曠野到利合，直到哈馬口。

sentences.english: So they went up， and searched the land from the wilderness of Zin unto Rehob， as men come to Hamath.
sentences.chinese: 他們上去窺探那地，從尋的曠野到利合，直到哈馬口。

sentences.english: And they removed from Eziongaber， and pitched in the wilderness of Zin， which is Kadesh.
sentences.chinese: 從以旬迦別起行，安營在尋的曠野，就是加低斯。

sentences.english: That, at least, is what American history suggests.
sentences.chinese: 至少，這在美國曆史上是有跡可尋的。

sentences.english: These were the waters of Meribah Kadesh, in the Desert of Zin.
sentences.chinese: 這水，就是尋的曠野加低斯米利巴水。

sentences.english: Use a variety of weapons, from lasers to fireballs, homing missiles and bombs.
sentences.chinese: 使用各種武器，從激光器火球，尋的導彈和炸彈。
